abstract: The banks are suing the bond insurer, claiming that its overhaul was intended to defraud policyholders.
snippet: The banks are suing the bond insurer, claiming that its overhaul was intended to defraud policyholders.
lead_paragraph: UBS, Bank of America and about a dozen other banks won reinstatement of a lawsuit against MBIA challenging the 2009 revamping of its insurance unit that guaranteed bad debt.

headline.main: New York Court Permits Banks to Sue MBIA
headline.print_headline: New York Court Permits Banks To Sue MBIA

abstract: The charge, which will drive the company to a multibillion-dollar loss in the second quarter, is the biggest single settlement tied to the subprime mortgage boom.
snippet: The charge, which will drive the company to a multibillion-dollar loss in the second quarter, is the biggest single settlement tied to the subprime mortgage boom.
lead_paragraph: Just how much will it cost the big banks to atone for the mortgage mess?

headline.main: Bank of America Settles Claims Stemming From Mortgage Crisis
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Settles Claims Stemming From Mortgage Crisis

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Eric Dash

abstract: Kathy D. Patrick, a litigator at the small Houston law firm Gibbs & Bruns, stared down Bank of America and secured an $8.5 billion settlement for her clients on Wednesday.
snippet: Kathy D. Patrick, a litigator at the small Houston law firm Gibbs & Bruns, stared down Bank of America and secured an $8.5 billion settlement for her clients on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: 4:40 p.m. | Updated DealBook doesn’t have a lawyer of the day award. But if it did the nod would go to Kathy D. Patrick, a litigator at a small Houston firm who stared down Bank of America and secured an $8.5 billion settlement for her clients — and an $85 million payday for her and her partners.

headline.main: The Lawyer Behind the Bank of America Settlement

abstract: Amid broad Wall Street layoffs, Credit Suisse plans to cut about 600 jobs across its global investment banking operation because demand has dropped for its products and services.
snippet: Amid broad Wall Street layoffs, Credit Suisse plans to cut about 600 jobs across its global investment banking operation because demand has dropped for its products and services.
lead_paragraph: Credit Suisse plans to cut about 600 jobs across its global investment banking operation because demand for its products and services has dropped, said a person with direct knowledge of the scheduled layoffs.

abstract: Bank of America has agreed to set aside $14 billion to settle claims stemming from sales of mortgage-backed securities. Nelson D. Schwartz explains how the bank will come up with the cash.
snippet: Bank of America has agreed to set aside $14 billion to settle claims stemming from sales of mortgage-backed securities. Nelson D. Schwartz explains how the bank will come up with the cash.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has agreed to set aside $14 billion to settle claims stemming from sales of mortgage-backed securities. Nelson D. Schwartz explains how the bank will come up with the cash.

abstract: Now that Bank of America has agreed to set aside $14 billion to settle claims stemming from sales of mortgage-backed securities, it has to come up with the cash. The New York Times’s business reporter Nelson D. Schwartz and finance editor Patrick Scott talk about how the settlement will affect the bank’s bottom line.
